record.dc:title: 19MCL6, 15MCL6, McLean County, Kentucky. Eaton Site. Features #3 and #5.
record.wpa:project_reservoir: Late Prehistoric Mississippian Sites in Kentucky
record.wpa:narrative: View of foundations of house structure (Feature #3) foundation taken from the North corner. Indicates method of isolating foundation en bloc and cutting posthole trench in longitudinal section. Post-holes in lateral trenches indicated in right hand trench a horizontal brace post is seen. Top of posthole trench is indicated by a line of white limestone rocks so placed for photographic reasons. Top outline of house floor (Feature #5) faintly detectable. Shallow driven corner postholes shown. From Notes: Weather -- clear and sunny. Adjustments -- f 32, 1/2 second. Subject -- Feature #3 en bloc and Feature #5. This shot taken to insure against failure of 16, 17, and 18 which were taken under poor light conditions late in afternoon (4:15). Camera position -- taken from dirt pile at North corner of Feature #3.
